verbose_text: XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR Impaired renal blood flow can lead to hypoxic injury to the renal tubular cells by depleting intracellular ATP, disrupting the intracelular calcium homeostasis, infiltration of leukocytes, injuring the endothelium, releasing cytokines and adhesion molecules and causing apoptosis.
evidence: injury to the renal tubular cells by depleting intracellular ATP, disrupting the intracelular calcium homeostasis
